NETWORK LEGS
One improvement that appeared possible with the transfer
of the network operation was the division of the stations into
four legs* This procedure allowed us to offer all programs to
all stations, and at the same time to materially reduce the total
time required for a program to complete the circuit* An
additional benefit of this method is a device for preventing a
complete breakdown of the network or any one of its legs,, Four
copies are made for distribution to the four legs* The master
is retained at headouarters0 If a tape is delayed or lost in
the mails, the station affected wires network headquarters to
this effect* Another copy is made and sent air-mail special-
delivery to the next station* Thus, only one station suffers and
the remainder of the leg stays on schedule*
It will be noted in the tabular summer of programs
that the number of stations accepting each series has been
steadily increasing. It is ouite apparent that at least part
of this trend is due to the increased efficiency possible when
operating by legs*
The four legs are shown on the accompanying maps*
